alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Essex, north central Addison and southwestern Chittenden Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 600 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Monkton Ridge, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, Burlington International Airport, South Burlington, Burlington, Charlotte, Hinesburg, St. George, Monkton Ridge, Monkton, Monkton Boro, Starksboro, Essex Junction Village, Williston, Shelburne, Mt. Philo State Park, Ferrisburgh, Richmond, Bristol, Mcneil Cove and Sloop Island. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 82 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
